strings.evolution:
The river may have many branches,
but all lead to the same sea.
I want to view the world with an open mind.
strings.affinity:
I must thank you all for giving this body,
which was only waiting to be reincarnated
once more, something to do.
strings.description: The eldest living Galkan from the distant world of Vana'diel. Easily over 200 years old, he fulfilled his purpose of holding together the leader-less Galkan people. The Galkans, made up only of males, are a race that begin life anew via a method known as "reincarnation." Once one perceives their own death, they quietly depart on a solo journey to be reincarnated. Werei, too, departed from his long-time friends, and departed on his journey to be reincarnated.
strings.fusion:
I have not yet matured.
I have yet much room for practice.
strings.summon:
Accomplish what needs to be accomplished.
I wish for you to take the path you believe in.

strings.evolution:
This must mean
my blade still has a purpose.
strings.affinity:
I must thank you all for giving this body,
which was only waiting to be reincarnated
once more, something to do.
strings.description: The eldest living Galkan from the distant world of Vana'diel. Once a famed swordsman who had carved out a name for himself, after losing the Raogrimm, "the Storyteller," he did what he could to support the leader-less Galkan people. However, having perceived his own death, in order to be "reincarnated," Werei disappeared from his people. News of him having left on a journey sent shockwaves through the Galkan community, and it is said that all Galkans yearned for him.
strings.fusion:
There are times when people
must face their own destiny,
no matter how difficult it may be.
strings.summon:
For the short time left until
I am reincarnated once again,
I will lend you my power.

strings.affinity:
I must thank you all for giving this body,
which was only waiting to be reincarnated
once more, something to do.
strings.description: The eldest living Galkan from the distant world of Vana'diel. Once a famed swordsman who had carved out a name for himself, he also taught his ways to Pagdako, whom the humes referred to as the "Iron Eater." After losing their previous leader in "the Storyteller" Raogrimm, it is said that Werei served as the spiritual pillar for his people for the next 30 years.
strings.fusion:
Training is not to be avoided.
In swordsmanship, there is nothing
more important than it.
strings.summon:
You must cut your own path forward.
Only you can decide for yourself.
I can, however, lend you my power.
